intro: Psychotria simmondsiana var. exigua, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
